conclusion: When two particles meet, they have the same position at the same time. Since they start at the same position, we need to find when their positions become equal again after separating.
Both particles start at the origin (0,0).
Particle A accelerates to 2v₀ at t = t₀, then decelerates to 0 at t = 3t₀.
Particle B accelerates more slowly, reaching v₀ at t = 4t₀, then decelerates to 0 at t = 6t₀.

premise: The position is the integral of velocity (area under the v-t curve).
conclusion: For particle A, from 0 to t₀: Area of triangle = ½ × t₀ × 2v₀ = v₀t₀.

premise: The position is the integral of velocity (area under the v-t curve).
conclusion: For particle A, from t₀ to 3t₀: Area of triangle = ½ × 2t₀ × 2v₀ = 2v₀t₀.

premise: The position is the integral of velocity (area under the v-t curve).
conclusion: Total distance traveled by A = v₀t₀ + 2v₀t₀ = 3v₀t₀.

premise: The position is the integral of velocity (area under the v-t curve).
conclusion: For particle B, from 0 to 4t₀: Area of triangle = ½ × 4t₀ × v₀ = 2v₀t₀.

premise: The position is the integral of velocity (area under the v-t curve).
conclusion: For particle B, from 4t₀ to 6t₀: Area of triangle = ½ × 2t₀ × v₀ = v₀t₀.

premise: The position is the integral of velocity (area under the v-t curve).
conclusion: Total distance traveled by B = 2v₀t₀ + v₀t₀ = 3v₀t₀.

premise: Particle A stops at t = 3t₀ after traveling 3v₀t₀ distance. Particle B stops at t = 6t₀ after traveling 3v₀t₀ distance.
conclusion: Both particles end up at the same position (3v₀t₀ from the origin) but at different times.

premise: Particle A reaches this final position at t = 3t₀ and remains there. Particle B reaches the same position at t = 6t₀.
conclusion: Particles A and B meet at t = 6t₀, when B finally catches up to A's position.
